Package: org.ajoberstar.grgit.operation

[Groovy] Class CleanOp

    • org.ajoberstar.grgit.operation.CleanOp
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      java.util.concurrent.Callable

      class CleanOp
extends java.lang.Object

      Remove untracked files from the working tree. Returns the list of file paths deleted.

      To clean all untracked files, but not ignored ones or untracked directories.

       def cleanedPaths = grgit.clean()

      To clean all untracked files and directories.

       def cleanedPaths = grgit.clean(directories: true)

      To clean all untracked files, including ignored ones.

       def cleanedPaths = grgit.clean(ignore: false)

      To only return files that would be cleaned.

       def cleanedPaths = grgit.clean(dryRun: true)

      To clean specific untracked files.

       def cleanedPaths = grgit.clean(paths: ['specific/file.txt'])
      See git-clean Manual Page.
      See Also:
      git-clean Manual Page
      Since:
      0.2.0

      • Properties Summary

          Properties 
          Type Name and description
          boolean  directories
          true if untracked directories should also be deleted, false (the default) otherwise
          boolean  dryRun
          true if the files should be returned, but not deleted, false (the default) otherwise
          boolean  ignore
          false if files ignored by .gitignore should also be deleted, true (the default) otherwise
          java.util.Set<java.lang.String>  paths
          The paths to clean.

      • Property Detail

        • boolean directories

          true if untracked directories should also be deleted, false (the default) otherwise

        • boolean dryRun

          true if the files should be returned, but not deleted, false (the default) otherwise

        • boolean ignore

          false if files ignored by .gitignore should also be deleted, true (the default) otherwise

        • java.util.Set<java.lang.String> paths

          The paths to clean. null if all paths should be included.
